423.description:
b'Kevin walked into the kitchen while Alice did the same. "Could you help me find the juice and the spoon?" Kevin asked as he walked towards the wineglass. "I found some juice in the kitchen cabinet and even in the bathroom cabinet, strangely enough. However, there are also a few places where I'm not sure if there is any juice. As for the spoon, it's in the kitchen cabinet, but again, I'm not certain about some other places," Alice responded while heading towards the wineglass. Kevin grabbed a wineglass as Alice grabbed another one.

Kevin walked to the kitchen table and placed the wineglass on it, while Alice grabbed a second wineglass and walked to the kitchen cabinet. Kevin then walked to the kitchen cabinet and opened it, while Alice opened the same cabinet. Kevin proceeded to open another kitchen cabinet as Alice opened yet another one. Kevin then opened the dishwasher while Alice put the wineglass on the kitchen table.

Kevin grabbed a spoon from the dishwasher and put it on the kitchen table, while Alice opened the fridge. Kevin grabbed a juice and placed it on the kitchen table as Alice grabbed a bottle of wine. Kevin then stood by as Alice put the wine on the kitchen table. Alice grabbed another juice and a second bottle of wine, placing the wine on the kitchen table. Finally, Alice grabbed a third juice and put it on the kitchen table.'

questions.1:
Given the above interaction, if Alice wants to help Kevin achieve his goal, which of the following locations did Alice most likely believe the juice was located when giving information?
A) Kitchen cabinet
B) Dishwasher
C) Bedroom
questions.2:
Given the above interaction, if Alice wants to help Kevin achieve his goal, which of the following objects did Alice most likely believe was inside the kitchen cabinet when giving information?
A) Fork
B) Juice
C) Wineglass
questions.3:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes that the juice is inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
A) Trying to help
B) Trying to hinder
C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.4:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes that there is nothing worthwhile inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
A) Trying to help
B) Trying to hinder
C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.5:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes the juice is only in the bathroom cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
A) Trying to help
B) Trying to hinder
C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
